item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: itaca_admin
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Suggested text: Our website address is: https://itaca.kinsta.cloud.

Comments

Suggested text: When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

Suggested text: If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Cookies

Suggested text: If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Suggested text: Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Who we share your data with

Suggested text: If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

Suggested text: If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

Suggested text: If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where your data is sent

Suggested text: Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

item.title: Lake Atitln (San Pedro y San Juan) Community
item.dc:creator: itaca_admin

item.title: ItacaHome
item.dc:creator: itaca_admin
item.content:encoded:
Where Every Journey Leads to
a Greater Destination

taca is more than a place to stay, eat, and exploreits a homecoming. From surf breaks on the Pacific coast to sunrises over Lake Atitln, taca brings together hostels, restaurants, and community spaces where travelers find belonging, growth, and connection.

Explore Our Restaurants Join the Loyalty Program

Welcome to taca

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod lorem

At taca, travel is both a metaphor for lifes journey and an act of connectionconnection to the land, to the food on your table, and to the people you meet along the way. We believe every path is more than a destination: its the moments, meals, and friendships that shape the journey.

Whether youre crashing at Driftwood Surfer in El Paredn, sharing a vegetarian feast at Luna y Sol, enjoying tapas at El Gato Perdido Bistro, or warming up with fresh, artisanal treats at the Deli, youre part of a bigger storyone rooted in community, sustainability, and adventure. As a part of Empresas que Suman con UNICEF, we take everything we do to the next level, ensuring that life's greatest adventures just keep getting better and better.

Every taca experience brings you closer to a greater destination.

Featured Lake Atitlan Locations

Luna y Sol

Hostel + Vegetarian Restaurant

Find your balance at Lake Atitln, a place for slow mornings, fresh plant-based meals, and community dinners that flow long into the night.

Lake Atitln, located in Guatemala's Western Highlands, is widely regarded as the most beautiful lake and one of the most beautiful lakes in Central America, making it a major tourist destination for travelers seeking natural beauty and cultural richness. This beautiful lake is surrounded by three volcanoesSan Pedro Volcano, Volcn San Pedro, and Atitln Volcanooffering incredible views and adventure activities like hiking and paragliding. The lake itself, known as lago de atitln, is the deepest lake in Central America, with a maximum depth of 340 meters (1,120 feet).

Visit Website

The best towns and villages around Lake Atitln each have their own unique personality and appeal. The lively town of San Pedro is popular for its nightlife and as a base for hiking Volcn San Pedro, while the artistic town of San Juan La Laguna is known for its colorful buildings, community art projects, and efforts to increase tourism through murals and local initiatives. Santa Cruz is a tranquil lake town built into the hillside, offering stunning views, and Santa Catarina Palopo is famous for its vibrant painted buildings and traditional dress. Santiago Atitln is a culturally rich town with deep Maya roots and a fascinating history, including its colonial-era Church of Saint Francis of Assisi, a building of great architectural and historical significance. San Marcos is a wellness and spiritual retreat town, attracting solo travelers and groups alike with yoga studios, meditation retreats, and events at places like Eagle's Nest, which boasts incredible views of the lake and volcanoes.

Exploring all the towns around the lake is highly recommended, as each village offers different experiences, from weaving and cooking workshops with local women to community gatherings and open mic nights. Tuk tuks are a common and convenient way to get around the towns, and boat rides make day trips to other lake towns easy and enjoyable. The southern part of the lake is especially scenic, with beautiful sunset views over the volcanoes, while the north side offers unique viewpoints and access to more remote villages.

Lake Atitln is a fantastic destination for solo travelers, with plenty of hostels, group activities, and opportunities to join tours or workshops led by locals. The regions history is rich, shaped by Maya heritage, colonial influences, and even the impact of Guatemala's civil war. The traditional dress worn by local women in each town reflects the areas cultural diversity. Many villages are built into the natural landscape, and the colorful buildings add to the charm and appeal of the area.

Whether youre swimming in the clear waters, paddleboarding at sunrise as the sun rises over the volcanoes, relaxing in hot springs, or hiking in the early hours to catch a beautiful sunrise, Lake Atitln offers something for everyone. While many accommodations are comfortable, note that air conditioning is often lacking, which can affect comfort during warmer periods. Guatemala as a country is renowned for its natural beauty, vibrant culture, and welcoming locals, making Lake Atitln a highlight of any trip to Central America.

Visit Website The Driftwood Surfer

Hostel + Beach Club

Wake up to ocean swells, chill by the pool, catch a turtle release at sunrise, or play beach volleyball at sunset. Driftwood is the perfect mix of surf, sleep, and social.

Visit Website El Gato Perdido Bistro

Restaurant

Gather with friends over fresh, exquisite dishes, paired with drinks that bring the evening to life. El Gato Perdido is a place where food, culture, and community come together in true taca style.

Visit Website El Gato Perdido Deli

Market + Eatery

Fresh meals, local coffee, and artisanal goods made to sharewhether youre bringing them home, packing for a road trip, or surprising someone with a gift. Part deli, part shop, fully local.

Visit Website

Find your balance at Lake Atitl\u00e1n, a place for slow mornings, fresh plant-based meals, and community dinners that flow long into the night.<\/p>

Lake Atitl\u00e1n, located in Guatemala's Western Highlands, is widely regarded as the most beautiful lake and one of the most beautiful lakes in Central America, making it a major tourist destination for travelers seeking natural beauty and cultural richness. This beautiful lake is surrounded by three volcanoes\u2014San Pedro Volcano, Volc\u00e1n San Pedro, and Atitl\u00e1n Volcano\u2014offering incredible views and adventure activities like hiking and paragliding. The lake itself, known as lago de atitl\u00e1n, is the deepest lake in Central America, with a maximum depth of 340 meters (1,120 The best towns and villages around Lake Atitl\u00e1n each have their own unique personality and appeal. The lively town of San Pedro is popular for its nightlife and as a base for hiking Volc\u00e1n San Pedro, while the artistic town of San Juan La Laguna is known for its colorful buildings, community art projects, and efforts to increase tourism through murals and local initiatives. Santa Cruz is a tranquil lake town built into the hillside, offering stunning views, and Santa Catarina Palopo is famous for its vibrant painted buildings and traditional dress. Santiago Atitl\u00e1n is a culturally rich town with deep Maya roots and a fascinating history, including its colonial-era Church of Saint Francis of Assisi, a building of great architectural and historical significance. San Marcos is a wellness and spiritual retreat town, attracting solo travelers and groups alike with yoga studios, meditation retreats, and events at places like Eagle's Nest, which boasts incredible views of the lake and Exploring all the towns around the lake is highly recommended, as each village offers different experiences, from weaving and cooking workshops with local women to community gatherings and open mic nights. Tuk tuks are a common and convenient way to get around the towns, and boat rides make day trips to other lake towns easy and enjoyable. The southern part of the lake is especially scenic, with beautiful sunset views over the volcanoes, while the north side offers unique viewpoints and access to more remote villages.<\/p>

Lake Atitl\u00e1n is a fantastic destination for solo travelers, with plenty of hostels, group activities, and opportunities to join tours or workshops led by locals. The region\u2019s history is rich, shaped by Maya heritage, colonial influences, and even the impact of Guatemala's civil war. The traditional dress worn by local women in each town reflects the area\u2019s cultural diversity. Many villages are built into the natural landscape, and the colorful buildings add to the charm and appeal of the area.<\/p>","typography_typography":"custom","typography_font_family":"Inter","typography_font_size":{"unit":"px","size":16,"sizes":[]},"typography_font_weight":"400","_padding":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":true},"__globals__":{"text_color":"globals\/colors?id=blocksy_palette_8"},"_animation":"fadeIn","align_mobile":"center","align_tablet":"center","_flex_align_self":"flex-start","_flex_align_self_tablet":"center","_element_custom_width":{"unit":"%","size":100,"sizes":[]},"typography_font_size_mobile":{"unit":"px","size":14,"sizes":[]},"_element_custom_width_tablet":{"unit":"%","size":95,"sizes":[]},"_element_custom_width_mobile":{"unit":"%","size":"","sizes":[]},"typography_font_size_tablet":{"unit":"px","size":14,"sizes":[]}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"text-editor"}],"isInner":true},{"id":"3896a87f","elType":"container","settings":{"background_color":"#121212","content_width":"full","width":{"unit":"%","size":50,"sizes":[]},"flex_wrap":"wrap","grid_columns_grid":{"unit":"fr","size":2,"sizes":[]},"grid_rows_grid":{"unit":"fr","size":1,"sizes":[]},"grid_auto_flow":"column","presetTitle":"Container","presetIcon":"eicon-container","parallax_background_uc_items":[],"flex_direction":"column","width_tablet":{"unit":"%","size":100,"sizes":[]},"width_mobile":{"unit":"%","size":"","sizes":[]},"min_height_mobile":{"unit":"vh","size":"","sizes":[]}},"elements":[{"id":"d792a6f","elType":"widget","settings":{"editor":"

Whether you\u2019re swimming in the clear waters, paddleboarding at sunrise as the sun rises over the volcanoes, relaxing in hot springs, or hiking in the early hours to catch a beautiful sunrise, Lake Atitl\u00e1n offers something for everyone. While many accommodations are comfortable, note that air conditioning is often lacking, which can affect comfort during warmer periods. Guatemala as a country is renowned for its natural beauty, vibrant culture, and welcoming locals, making Lake Atitl\u00e1n a highlight of any trip to Central item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: itaca_admin
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: itaca_admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Our Locations
item.dc:creator: itaca_admin
item.content:encoded:
Our Locations

Find your next meal, bed, or beach day across our two favorite corners of Guatemala.

Restaurants

El Gato Perdido Bistro

Seasonal lakeside dining with a chef-driven menu and wine or cocktails that actually pair. Date night, group dinners, post-hike reward, this is the move.
  • Best for: Foodies, couples, friends in town
  • Highlights: Seasonal plates, made-from-scratch, cozy interior, patio seating
Explore the Bistro Taste seasonal plates made from scratch Sip curated wines & craft cocktails Dine inside or out on the lakeside patio

The Deli (Restaurant + Market)

Eat in, grab-and-go, or stock your casita. Fresh sandwiches, salads, coffee, pastries, and a small market with pantry goods, sauces, ice cream, and giftable jars.
  • Best for: Quick lunch, picnics, stocking up
  • Highlights: House-made items, artisanal groceries, take-away friendly
See Menu See Market From-scratch plates you can eat in or take away Grab fresh-made sandwiches, salads & pizza

Hostels + Restaurants

The Driftwood Surfer

Beachfront hostel + rooftop restaurant + pool bar + surf school. Renovated spaces, black-sand sunsets, & day passes for the Beach Club.
  • Best for: Surfers, backpackers, remote workers, friend groups
  • Highlights: Surf lessons & rentals, beachfront pool, daily events, rooftop dining
Book Your Stay View Food & Bar Menus Catch waves with surf lessons & rentals Feast on the rooftop with ocean views Dive into the beachfront pool & bar

Luna y Sol

Colorful lakeside hideaway with a plant-forward restaurant. Chill garden mornings, sunlit lunches, & community events.
  • Best for: Digital nomads, slow travelers, small groups
  • Highlights: Fresh, plant-based dishes, calm rooms, walkable to docks & trails, & curated wellness events
Book A Room View Restaurant Unwind in calm rooms steps from the lake Nourish yourself with fresh, plant-based dishes Restore balance with wellness events

One more thing

Every meal, every stay, every step moves you forward. With taca Loyalty Points, each stop on your journey reveals new rewards.

Join in 30 seconds

Sign up for taca Loyalty

item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: itaca_admin
item.content:encoded:
Where Every Journey Leads to
a Greater Destination

taca is more than a place to stay, eat, and exploreits a homecoming. From surf breaks on the Pacific coast to sunrises over Lake Atitln, taca brings together hostels, restaurants, and community spaces where travelers find belonging, growth, and connection.

Explore Our Restaurants Join the Loyalty Program

Welcome to taca

At taca, travel is both a metaphor for lifes journey and an act of connectionconnection to the land, to the food on your table, and to the people you meet along the way. We believe every path is more than a destination: its the moments, meals, and friendships that shape the journey.

Whether youre crashing at Driftwood Surfer in El Paredn, sharing a vegetarian feast at Luna y Sol, enjoying tapas at El Gato Perdido Bistro, or warming up with fresh, artisanal treats at the Deli, youre part of a bigger storyone rooted in community, sustainability, and adventure. As a part of Empresas que Suman con UNICEF, we take everything we do to the next level, ensuring that life's greatest adventures just keep getting better and better.

Every taca experience brings you closer to a greater destination.

Featured Lake Atitlan Locations

Luna y Sol

Hostel + Vegetarian Restaurant

Find your balance at Lake Atitln, a place for slow mornings, fresh plant-based meals, and community dinners that flow long into the night.

Lake Atitln, located in Guatemala's Western Highlands, is widely regarded as the most beautiful lake and one of the most beautiful lakes in Central America, making it a major tourist destination for travelers seeking natural beauty and cultural richness. This beautiful lake is surrounded by three volcanoesSan Pedro Volcano, Volcn San Pedro, and Atitln Volcanooffering incredible views and adventure activities like hiking and paragliding. The lake itself, known as lago de atitln, is the deepest lake in Central America, with a maximum depth of 340 meters (1,120 feet).

Visit Website

The best towns and villages around Lake Atitln each have their own unique personality and appeal. The lively town of San Pedro is popular for its nightlife and as a base for hiking Volcn San Pedro, while the artistic town of San Juan La Laguna is known for its colorful buildings, community art projects, and efforts to increase tourism through murals and local initiatives. Santa Cruz is a tranquil lake town built into the hillside, offering stunning views, and Santa Catarina Palopo is famous for its vibrant painted buildings and traditional dress. Santiago Atitln is a culturally rich town with deep Maya roots and a fascinating history, including its colonial-era Church of Saint Francis of Assisi, a building of great architectural and historical significance. San Marcos is a wellness and spiritual retreat town, attracting solo travelers and groups alike with yoga studios, meditation retreats, and events at places like Eagle's Nest, which boasts incredible views of the lake and volcanoes.

Exploring all the towns around the lake is highly recommended, as each village offers different experiences, from weaving and cooking workshops with local women to community gatherings and open mic nights. Tuk tuks are a common and convenient way to get around the towns, and boat rides make day trips to other lake towns easy and enjoyable. The southern part of the lake is especially scenic, with beautiful sunset views over the volcanoes, while the north side offers unique viewpoints and access to more remote villages.

Lake Atitln is a fantastic destination for solo travelers, with plenty of hostels, group activities, and opportunities to join tours or workshops led by locals. The regions history is rich, shaped by Maya heritage, colonial influences, and even the impact of Guatemala's civil war. The traditional dress worn by local women in each town reflects the areas cultural diversity. Many villages are built into the natural landscape, and the colorful buildings add to the charm and appeal of the area.

Whether youre swimming in the clear waters, paddleboarding at sunrise as the sun rises over the volcanoes, relaxing in hot springs, or hiking in the early hours to catch a beautiful sunrise, Lake Atitln offers something for everyone. While many accommodations are comfortable, note that air conditioning is often lacking, which can affect comfort during warmer periods. Guatemala as a country is renowned for its natural beauty, vibrant culture, and welcoming locals, making Lake Atitln a highlight of any trip to Central America.

Visit Website The Driftwood Surfer

Hostel + Beach Club

Wake up to ocean swells, chill by the pool, catch a turtle release at sunrise, or play beach volleyball at sunset. Driftwood is the perfect mix of surf, sleep, and social.

Visit Website El Gato Perdido Bistro

Restaurant

Gather with friends over fresh, exquisite dishes, paired with drinks that bring the evening to life. El Gato Perdido is a place where food, culture, and community come together in true taca style.

Visit Website El Gato Perdido Deli

Market + Eatery

Fresh meals, local coffee, and artisanal goods made to sharewhether youre bringing them home, packing for a road trip, or surprising someone with a gift. Part deli, part shop, fully local.

Visit Website

Find your balance at Lake Atitl\u00e1n, a place for slow mornings, fresh plant-based meals, and community dinners that flow long into the night.<\/p>

Lake Atitl\u00e1n, located in Guatemala's Western Highlands, is widely regarded as the most beautiful lake and one of the most beautiful lakes in Central America, making it a major tourist destination for travelers seeking natural beauty and cultural richness. This beautiful lake is surrounded by three volcanoes\u2014San Pedro Volcano, Volc\u00e1n San Pedro, and Atitl\u00e1n Volcano\u2014offering incredible views and adventure activities like hiking and paragliding. The lake itself, known as lago de atitl\u00e1n, is the deepest lake in Central America, with a maximum depth of 340 meters (1,120 feet).<\/p>","typography_typography":"custom","typography_font_family":"Inter","typography_font_size":{"unit":"px","size":16,"sizes":[]},"typography_font_weight":"400","_padding":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":true},"__globals__":{"text_color":"globals\/colors?id=blocksy_palette_8"},"_animation":"fadeIn","align_mobile":"center","align_tablet":"center","_flex_align_self":"flex-start","_flex_align_self_tablet":"center","_element_custom_width":{"unit":"%","size":100,"sizes":[]},"typography_font_size_mobile":{"unit":"px","size":14,"sizes":[]},"_element_custom_width_tablet":{"unit":"%","size":95,"sizes":[]},"_element_custom_width_mobile":{"unit":"%","size":"","sizes":[]},"typography_font_size_tablet":{"unit":"px","size":14,"sizes":[]},"eael_image_masking_custom_clip_path":"clip-path: The best towns and villages around Lake Atitl\u00e1n each have their own unique personality and appeal. The lively town of San Pedro is popular for its nightlife and as a base for hiking Volc\u00e1n San Pedro, while the artistic town of San Juan La Laguna is known for its colorful buildings, community art projects, and efforts to increase tourism through murals and local initiatives. Santa Cruz is a tranquil lake town built into the hillside, offering stunning views, and Santa Catarina Palopo is famous for its vibrant painted buildings and traditional dress. Santiago Atitl\u00e1n is a culturally rich town with deep Maya roots and a fascinating history, including its colonial-era Church of Saint Francis of Assisi, a building of great architectural and historical significance. San Marcos is a wellness and spiritual retreat town, attracting solo travelers and groups alike with yoga studios, meditation retreats, and events at places like Eagle's Nest, which boasts incredible views of the lake and Exploring all the towns around the lake is highly recommended, as each village offers different experiences, from weaving and cooking workshops with local women to community gatherings and open mic nights. Tuk tuks are a common and convenient way to get around the towns, and boat rides make day trips to other lake towns easy and enjoyable. The southern part of the lake is especially scenic, with beautiful sunset views over the volcanoes, while the north side offers unique viewpoints and access to more remote villages.<\/p>

Lake Atitl\u00e1n is a fantastic destination for solo travelers, with plenty of hostels, group activities, and opportunities to join tours or workshops led by locals. The region\u2019s history is rich, shaped by Maya heritage, colonial influences, and even the impact of Guatemala's civil war. The traditional dress worn by local women in each town reflects the area\u2019s cultural diversity. Many villages are built into the natural landscape, and the colorful buildings add to the charm and appeal of the area.<\/p>","typography_typography":"custom","typography_font_family":"Inter","typography_font_size":{"unit":"px","size":16,"sizes":[]},"typography_font_weight":"400","_padding":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":true},"__globals__":{"text_color":"globals\/colors?id=blocksy_palette_8"},"_animation":"fadeIn","align_mobile":"center","align_tablet":"center","_flex_align_self":"flex-start","_flex_align_self_tablet":"center","_element_custom_width":{"unit":"%","size":100,"sizes":[]},"typography_font_size_mobile":{"unit":"px","size":14,"sizes":[]},"_element_custom_width_tablet":{"unit":"%","size":95,"sizes":[]},"_element_custom_width_mobile":{"unit":"%","size":"","sizes":[]},"typography_font_size_tablet":{"unit":"px","size":14,"sizes":[]},"eael_image_masking_custom_clip_path":"clip-path: Whether you\u2019re swimming in the clear waters, paddleboarding at sunrise as the sun rises over the volcanoes, relaxing in hot springs, or hiking in the early hours to catch a beautiful sunrise, Lake Atitl\u00e1n offers something for everyone. While many accommodations are comfortable, note that air conditioning is often lacking, which can affect comfort during warmer periods. Guatemala as a country is renowned for its natural beauty, vibrant culture, and welcoming locals, making Lake Atitl\u00e1n a highlight of any trip to Central item.title: About Us
item.dc:creator: itaca_admin
item.content:encoded:
About taca: Sustainable Hospitality in Guatemalas Top Destinations

Hospitality with soul, from shore to shore

Were a family-led hospitality group in Guatemala, with four restaurants, two hostels, and a beachfront private home stretching from black-sand sunsets on the Pacific Coast to lakefront mornings on Lake Atitln. Every space is created to welcome, to nourish, and to connectturning each visit into an experience that lingers.

Our promise is simple: exceptional service, meaningful experiences, and lasting impact. taca reflects the belief that travel is never just about where you go, but what you discover along the way. With taca, every destination leads to a new journey.

Where we are

  • El Paredn (Pacific Coast)
  • San Pedro La Laguna (Lake Atitln)
  • San Juan La Laguna (Lake Atitln)
  • Monterrico (Pacific Coast)

What we run

  • The Driftwood Surfer hostel, surf, pool, bar + restaurant (El Paredn). The Driftwood Surfer offers private rooms in addition to dorms, a gorgeous pool, and a rooftop restaurant.

  • Luna y Sol co-living hostel + vegetarian restaurant (San Pedro)

  • Los Pelcanos - beachfront Private Home (Monterrico)

  • El Gato Perdido Bistro elevated local dining (San Pedro)

  • El Gato Perdido Deli artisanal market + delicatessen (San Juan)

El Paredn and Lake Atitln: Guatemalas Top Travel Destinations

Guatemala is home to some of Central Americas most stunning destinations, and two of the most popular are the Pacific coast with black volcanic sand beaches in both El Paredn and Monterrico, and Lake Atitln in the highlands with San Juan la Laguna and San Pedro la Laguna. Each location offers unique experiences for travelerswhether youre seeking surf and sand or volcano views and cultural immersion. Heres everything you need to know about visiting the Pacific Coast and Lake Atitln.

El Paredn Surf Hostel: Lessons, Social Events & Turtle Releases

El Paredn has earned a reputation as one of Guatemalas best surf destinations, attracting surfers from around the world. Surf camps in El Paredn offer lessons for all levels, making it a great spot for both beginners and advanced surfers. Seasonal turtle releases, yoga sessions, and beachside relaxation round out the experience.

The town has a laid-back atmosphere, where the hospitality industry is growing rapidly, with new restaurants, bars, and boutique hotels opening each season. Visitors can enjoy day passes at hostels and beach clubs like The Driftwood Surfer, which include access to pools, ocean views, and social events like live music and pub quizzes.

Eco-tourism is also on the rise in El Paredn, with various El Paredn tours available. Popular activities include kayaking through the mangrove tunnels of Sipacate-Naranjo National Park and joining community-supported tours like horseback riding along the beach or fishing in either the mangroves or the ocean. Many businesses contribute a portion of proceeds to the community, such as funding for the local school or sustainability, making your visit both memorable and meaningful.

Monterrico, Guatemala: Turtle Conservation & Pacific Coast Escape

Just a few hours from Guatemala City, Monterrico is another Pacific coast gem, best known for its wide beaches, relaxed vibe, and turtle conservation programs. Visitors can join turtle release activities, where hatchlings are released into the ocean at sunseta magical and educational experience.

Our house includes a sanctuary right on the property, meaning the space is all yours to enjoyan exclusive experience where you can witness turtle conservation up close without the crowds.

Beyond the turtles, Monterrico is also home to mangrove-lined waterways, perfect for boat tours and birdwatching along the Pacific Ocean. With its mix of eco-lodges, boutique hotels, and beachfront restaurants, the town offers a slower pace than El Paredn, making it popular for families, couples, and travelers looking to unwind by the sea.

Lake Atitln Travel Guide: Culture, Adventure & Mayan Villages

Just four hours from El Paredn, Lake Atitln offers a completely different experience. Surrounded by volcanoes and traditional Mayan villages, the lake is often described as one of the most beautiful in the world. Travelers come here for both relaxation and adventure.

Atitln is famous for its vibrant communitieseach lakeside town offers a distinct personality. San Pedro La Laguna is popular with backpackers and nightlife seekers, while San Marcos is a hub for yoga, meditation, and holistic retreats.

Outdoor activities at the lake include kayaking, hiking, and paddleboarding, as well as volcano treks for the adventurous. Visitors can also join textile workshops, cooking classes, and cultural tours to learn about local traditions. The food scene at the lake continues to grow, featuring everything from street food stalls to farm-to-table dining.

San Juan La Laguna: Culture & Wellness

San Juan La Laguna is a cultural hub on Lake Atitlans western shore. Known for its Mayan weaving collectives, natural dye workshops, and coffee cooperatives, the town offers an authentic glimpse into local life. Visitors can book cultural tours, hike to the Mirador Kaqasiiwaan, or take part in yoga and wellness retreats on the lakes edge. Its peaceful vibe makes it ideal for travelers who want immersion and relaxation.

San Pedro La Laguna: Adventure & Nightlife

Just a short boat ride away, San Pedro La Laguna has a completely different energy. Popular with backpackers, this town combines adventure tourism with a lively nightlife. You can hike San Pedro Volcano, rent a kayak, or take Spanish lessons at one of its many language schools. In the evenings, restaurants and bars come alive, making it a social hub. San Pedro offers both adrenaline-filled days and fun nights on the lake.

How to Get to El Paredn & Lake Atitln from Guatemala City & Antigua

Both destinations are easily accessible from Guatemala City and Antigua.

Shared shuttles, chicken buses, and private transfers are the most common options. Booking shuttle tickets in advance is recommended.

Many visitors combine the two destinations in one tripenjoying the cool climate and cultural richness of Lake Atitln before heading down to the coast to surf in El Paredn.

Best Time to Visit El Paredn, Monterrico, & Lake Atitln, Guatemala

The dry season (NovemberApril) is the most popular time to visit both El Paredn and Lake Atitln, with sunny weather and ideal conditions for surfing, hiking, and exploring. The rainy season (MayOctober) brings heavier downpours, although normally just for a few hours in the afternoon (so not a deal breaker) or at night, but it also means lush landscapes and fewer crowds.

Seasonal highlights include turtle releases on the coast and cultural festivals around Lake Atitln.

Eco-Tourism & Wellness in Guatemala: Lake Atitln & Pacific Coast

Both destinations are embracing wellness and eco-tourism.

  • On the Pacific Coast, yoga classes, beach volleyball, and turtle sanctuaries (and therefore, daily turtle releases from September through December) are held on the beach or at boutique hostels.

  • Around Lake Atitln, wellness retreats, meditation centers, and healing workshops have become a signature draw.

Sustainability is also a key theme, from eco-lodges like Luna y Sol on lake Atitln to community-supported tours in El Paredn, giving travelers the chance to make a positive impact.

Why Visit Both the Pacific Coast and Lake Atitln:

The most important thing is that together, they represent the best of Guatemalas adventure, culture, and relaxation. Whether youre a surfer, yogi, foodie, or explorer, visiting both destinations will give you a deeper experience of Guatemala.

Explore Our Locations

The People of taca: Our Hospitality Team in Guatemala

Real Humans. Real Stories. The Heart of Every taca Experience.

At taca, our greatest asset isnt a building, a bar, or even a beachfront view; its our people. Across all five of our businesses, we are powered by a diverse and passionate team of local hosts, chefs, bartenders, housekeepers, surf instructors, entertainment leaders, and hospitality managers who bring the taca spirit to life every single day.

Whether youre staying at one of our hostels, dining at our restaurants, joining an event, or learning something new, youll notice the same thing right away: the people make the experience. From the cook who prepares a meal with ingredients sourced from local producers, to the bartender who remembers your order after the first round, to the surf instructor who cheers you on when you catch your first waveeach of them plays a part in why guests keep coming back.

Human-Centered Hospitality Across taca Hostels & Restaurants

What makes taca different is our commitment to personal, human-centered hospitality. No matter which of our businesses you interact with, our team takes time to learn your name, connect with your story, and share a little of ours. This approach transforms ordinary service into a meaningful connection, making every visit memorable, whether you came for a meal, an event, or a week-long stay.

Rooted in Local Culture and Community

tacas team members arent just staff they are locals who carry the traditions, culture, and stories of true Guatemalan heritage. By hiring and training within the community, we ensure every guest experiences authentic warmth and hospitality that reflects the place we call home. Every smile, recommendation, and shared moment is part of our mission to create sustainable, community-first tourism and hospitality.

Come Meet the Faces of taca

Hospitality here is never genericits deeply personal. Whether youre welcomed into one of our hostels, enjoying a night at our bar, or joining a cultural event, the taca team is what makes the experience unforgettable.

Meet the taca Team

Come for the views. Stay for the people.

More Than a HostelWe're a Community

Whether youre here to surf world-class waves, cowork with views of some of the most stunning shores the world has to offer, slow down and recharge, or celebrate lifes milestones, taca offers more than accommodation. We are a destination for travelers who value connection, sustainability, and culture.

Our beachfront location puts you steps from the ocean, while our coworking-friendly spaces make us the perfect spot for digital nomads seeking balance. Add in a supportive team, fresh local food, and events that bring travelers and locals togetherand youll understand why so many guests return again and again.

Your Experience at taca

  • Sunrise surf lessons led by experienced local instructors.

  • Shared meals with seasonal, responsibly sourced menus.

  • Coworking spaces designed for productivity with a view.

  • Community events, from music nights to beach clean-ups.

  • A welcoming vibe that feels like family from day one.

Whether youre here to surf, cowork, slow down, or celebrate, theres a seat at our table.

Join Us

Each location offers unique experiences for travelers\u2014whether you\u2019re seeking surf and sand or volcano views and cultural immersion.       El Pared\u00f3n has earned a reputation as one of Guatemala\u2019s best surf destinations<\/strong>, attracting surfers from around the world. Surf camps in El Pared\u00f3n<\/strong> offer lessons for all levels, making it a great spot for both beginners and advanced surfers. Seasonal turtle releases, yoga sessions, and beachside relaxation round out the experience.<\/p>

      The town has a laid-back atmosphere, where the hospitality industry is growing rapidly, with new restaurants, bars, and boutique hotels opening each season. Visitors can enjoy day passes at hostels and beach clubs like The Driftwood Surfer<\/strong>, which include access to pools, ocean views, and social events like live music and pub quizzes.<\/p>

      Eco-tourism is also on the rise in El Pared\u00f3n, with various El Pared\u00f3n tours available. Popular activities include kayaking through the mangrove tunnels<\/strong> of Sipacate-Naranjo National Park and joining community-supported tours<\/strong> like horseback riding along the beach or fishing in either the mangroves or the ocean. Many businesses contribute a portion of proceeds to the community, such as funding for the local school or sustainability, making your visit both memorable and meaningful.<\/p>","typography_typography":"custom","typography_font_family":"Inter","typography_font_size":{"unit":"px","size":16,"sizes":[]},"typography_font_weight":"400","_padding":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":true},"__globals__":{"text_color":"globals\/colors?id=primary"},"_animation":"fadeIn","align_mobile":"center","_flex_align_self_tablet":"center","_element_custom_width":{"unit":"%","size":100,"sizes":[]},"typography_font_size_mobile":{"unit":"px","size":14,"sizes":[]},"_element_custom_width_tablet":{"unit":"%","size":95,"sizes":[]},"_element_custom_width_mobile":{"unit":"%","size":"","sizes":[]},"typography_font_size_tablet":{"unit":"px","size":14,"sizes":[]},"eael_image_masking_custom_clip_path":"clip-path:       Just a few hours from Guatemala City, Monterrico<\/strong> is another Pacific coast gem, best known for its wide beaches, relaxed vibe, and turtle conservation programs. Visitors can join turtle release activities<\/strong>, where hatchlings are released into the ocean at sunset\u2014a magical and educational experience.<\/p>

      Our house includes a sanctuary right on the property<\/strong>, meaning the space is all yours to enjoy\u2014an exclusive experience where you can witness turtle conservation up close without the crowds.<\/p>

      Beyond the turtles, Monterrico is also home to mangrove-lined waterways<\/strong>, perfect for boat tours and birdwatching along the Pacific Ocean. With its mix of eco-lodges, boutique hotels, and beachfront restaurants, the town offers a slower pace than El Pared\u00f3n, making it popular for families, couples, and travelers looking to unwind by the       Just four hours from El Pared\u00f3n, Lake Atitl\u00e1n offers a completely different experience. Surrounded by volcanoes and traditional Mayan villages, the lake is often described as one of the most beautiful in the world. Travelers come here for both relaxation and adventure.<\/p>

      Atitl\u00e1n is famous for its vibrant communities<\/strong>\u2014each lakeside town offers a distinct personality. San Pedro La Laguna is popular with backpackers and nightlife seekers, while San Marcos is a hub for yoga, meditation, and holistic retreats.<\/p>

      Outdoor activities at the lake include kayaking, hiking, and paddleboarding<\/strong>, as well as volcano treks for the adventurous. Visitors can also join textile workshops, cooking classes, and cultural tours<\/strong> to learn about local traditions. The food scene at the lake continues to grow, featuring everything from street food stalls to farm-to-table dining.<\/p>","typography_typography":"custom","typography_font_family":"Inter","typography_font_size":{"unit":"px","size":16,"sizes":[]},"typography_font_weight":"400","_padding":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":true},"__globals__":{"text_color":"globals\/colors?id=primary"},"_animation":"fadeIn","align_mobile":"center","_flex_align_self_tablet":"center","_element_custom_width":{"unit":"%","size":100,"sizes":[]},"typography_font_size_mobile":{"unit":"px","size":14,"sizes":[]},"_element_custom_width_tablet":{"unit":"%","size":95,"sizes":[]},"_element_custom_width_mobile":{"unit":"%","size":"","sizes":[]},"typography_font_size_tablet":{"unit":"px","size":14,"sizes":[]},"eael_image_masking_custom_clip_path":"clip-path:       The dry season (November\u2013April)<\/strong> is the most popular time to visit both El Pared\u00f3n and Lake Atitl\u00e1n, with sunny weather and ideal conditions for surfing, hiking, and exploring. The rainy season (May\u2013October)<\/strong> brings heavier downpours, although normally just for a few hours in the afternoon (so not a deal breaker) or at night, but it also means lush landscapes and fewer crowds.<\/p>

      Seasonal highlights include turtle releases on the coast<\/strong> and cultural festivals around Lake       Both destinations are embracing wellness and eco-tourism<\/strong>.<\/p>

      • On the Pacific Coast, yoga classes, beach volleyball, and turtle sanctuaries (and therefore, daily turtle releases from September through December) are held on the beach or at boutique hostels.<\/p><\/li>

      • Around Lake Atitl\u00e1n, wellness retreats, meditation centers, and healing workshops have become a signature draw.<\/p><\/li><\/ul>

        Sustainability is also a key theme<\/strong>, from eco-lodges like Luna y Sol on lake Atitl\u00e1n to community-supported tours in El Pared\u00f3n, giving travelers the chance to make a         At \u00cdtaca, our greatest asset isn\u2019t a building, a bar, or even a beachfront view; it\u2019s our people<\/em>. Across all five of our businesses, we are powered by a diverse and passionate team of local hosts, chefs, bartenders, housekeepers, surf instructors, entertainment leaders, and hospitality managers<\/strong> who bring the \u00cdtaca spirit to life every single day.<\/p>

        Whether you\u2019re staying at one of our hostels, dining at our restaurants, joining an event, or learning something new, you\u2019ll notice the same thing right away: the people make the experience. From the cook who prepares a meal with ingredients sourced from local producers, to the bartender who remembers your order after the first round, to the surf instructor who cheers you on when you catch your first wave\u2014each of them plays a part in why guests keep coming         Whether you\u2019re here to surf world-class waves, cowork with views of some of the most stunning shores the world has to offer, slow down and recharge, or celebrate life\u2019s milestones<\/strong>, \u00cdtaca offers more than accommodation. We are a destination for travelers who value connection, sustainability, and culture<\/strong>.<\/p>
